result.execSummary:
The defendant Caleb Joseph Walden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. 
Provide DNA sample.

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription.
Expungement under 973.015 upon; Successful completion of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Letter to the Judge from Atty. Kaehne re: date for return of property

9:01 AM Defendant Caleb Joseph Walden appeared by phone.  Attorney Brett Tyler Kaehne appeared by phone for Caleb Joseph Walden.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights on file.
Defendant waives right to an in-person hearing today. 
State -  Deft to plead to Count 2 and State recommends 1 year of Probation with conditions up to the Court and Defense free to argue.
Count 1 & 3 DRI.
Deft pleads No Contest to Count 2 - Court finds Guilty. Counts 1 & 3 are Dismissed and Read in.
Court has received and reviewed Character letters that were filed by Defnese.
Atty Kaehne - proceed to sentencing today.
State makes sentencing argument.
Atty Kaehne - joint recommendation for 1 year Probation and conditions left to Court. 2 days credit. Makes sentencing argument and requests Expungement upon successful completion of Probation.
Court orders 1 year Probation with 2 days Credit if revoked and conditions as stated on the record. Court grants Expungement upon successful completion of Probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
